result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mitchell C Griffin

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 9:17 AM
Attorney Charlie Hoffmann in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney John M Binder in court for Mitchell C Griffin. 
Defendant Mitchell C Griffin in court. 
Defense requests that SCRAM/CAM monitoring be removed.
State has no objection.
Court grants. 
Attorney Binder requests another hearing date.
Hearing scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Bail/bond hearing on September 26, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Bail/bond hearing on September 26, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Notice of Motion and Motion to Modify Bond;  filed by Atty. John Binder  
**Reviewed by Judge Melvin on 09-07-2022:  to be addressed at next hearing on 09-26-2022
treatment letter from Becker/Gibeau Psychological Services, LLC, undated;  filed by Atty. John Binder
Letter from Addiction Resource Council, Inc. dated August 15, 2022 re: AODA Assessment
Authorization to Appear;  filed by Attorney John Binder

Cash bail previously posted to be refunded to poster.  Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms/knives.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  The defendant is ordered to comply with CAM monitoring through WCS.  CAM duration pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols.  Defendant to pay costs associated with CAM.  Defendant to report to WCS immediately after Court today.  Defendant is not to have any violent contact with Victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

08:49 AM Defendant Mitchell C Griffin in court with Attorney Olivia Garman for Attorney John M Binder.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Julian Marrufo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
